messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] England
messages.msgSnippet: ... Where you flying from? Fares should be about $400 in May. Virgin Atlantic flies to London, British Midlands flies to Manchester but thats a 6 hour drive to
messages.messageBody:
On 27 Nov 02, at 14:31, starsuncloud@... wrote:

> Ok, you've all got me thinking now.
> I really don't think I can afford England with my trip planned to
> Alaska already (in July) but I want to know more. Is London the best
> place to fly into? I heard someone saying the fares are better in May,
> but everything I've found so far is over $800 usd, is that good?
> yikes. And what are the dates again?
>
> Ren


Where you flying from?
Fares should be about $400 in May.
Virgin Atlantic flies to London, British Midlands flies to Manchester
but thats a 6 hour drive to hesfes then.
Birmingham is a possibility. I think BA may go there from here.

I paid $412 for me and $203 for the kids when I flew DC to London
last May.
Flights from New York, Orlando and DC tend to be cheaper.

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: England
messages.msgSnippet: Ok, you ve all got me thinking now. I really don t think I can afford England with my trip planned to Alaska already (in July) but I want to know more. Is
messages.messageBody:
Ok, you've all got me thinking now.
I really don't think I can afford England with my trip planned to Alaska
already (in July) but I want to know more.
Is London the best place to fly into?
I heard someone saying the fares are better in May, but everything I've found
so far is over $800 usd, is that good? yikes.
And what are the dates again?

Ren
"The answers aren't important really...
What's important, is knowing all the questions."
-Zilpha Keatley Snyder
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
